title: (x) Art Nouveau/Hobo type font in logo - Hercules (Herkules) {Mark S}
content:
Hi

Trying to identify the typeface in this logo. I need to recreate it for my client as a vector file. It was probably created late 80's early 90's in Australia. The closest I got was Hobo. I have used Indentifont and WhatTheFont to no avail.

Can anyone help?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Logo\_scan.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20110315095456/http:/typophile.com/files/Logo_scan.jpg) | 127.04 KB |
author: katedev

comments.content: There was an old film font called Hercules that this matches, but the only digital font I found with that name is a completely different design. It's possible that there is a digital version of Hercules with a different name.

I think this was an old Letrasetfont called Herkules, based on an old Art Nouveau era typeface called Hercules. I think Dieter Steffmann at typOasis (Designer section) has a [digital version](http://web.archive.org/web/20110315095456/http:/www.moorstation.org/typoasis/designers/steffmann/samples/h/herkules.htm) of it.

- Mike Yanega

Thankyou so much. Herkules saved me. Should have clicked that it would be an old Letraset typeface.  
Once again - thanks!  
Cheers, Kate
